org.j2free.cache
Interface FragmentCache<T extends Fragment>

Type Parameters:
T -
All Known Implementing Classes:
MemoryFragmentCache
@ThreadSafe
public interface FragmentCache<T extends Fragment>

Interface defining a FragmentCache, so that the FragmentCacheTag doesn't have to deal with the semantics of how the cache is implemented. This allows for multiple implementations; e.g. an in-memory cache, or a cache that uses memcached as a distributed store for Fragments. ALL implementations MUST be thread-safe and provide a constructor taking a Configuration in order to be configuratble via properties. Alternatively, implementations that do not need properties configuration can provide a no-args constructor and be created via properties config as well.

Method Detail

destroy

void destroy()
Performs any resource cleanup

clear

int clear()
Removes all Fragment instances from the FragmentCache.

Returns:
the number of Fragment instances the cache held before the clear.

contains

boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
Tests if the specified key is in this cache.

Parameters:
key - possible key
Returns:
true if and only if the specified key is in this cache, otherwise false.

createFragment

T createFragment(java.lang.String condition,
                 long timeout)
Creates a new Fragment of the default type supported by this implementation.

Parameters:
condition - An optional condition upon creation of the Fragment; if the condition supplied to tryAcquireLock does not match this condition, then the cache considers itself in need of update.
timeout - The timeout for this cached Fragment
Returns:
the new Fragment

createFragment

T createFragment(T content,
                 java.lang.String condition,
                 long timeout)
Creates a new Fragment of the default type supported by this implementation.

Parameters:
content - An start value for the content of this Fragment
condition - An optional condition upon creation of the Fragment; if the condition supplied to tryAcquireLock does not match this condition, then the cache considers itself in need of update.
timeout - The timeout for this cached Fragment
Returns:
the new Fragment

get

T get(java.lang.String key)
Gets the Fragment stored under the argument key if one exists.

Parameters:
key - The key of a Fragment to get
Returns:
The Fragment stored via the argument key otherwise null.

getStatistics

FragmentCacheStatistics getStatistics()
Returns:
statistics about the current state of the cache, or historical data if the implementation supports that.

evict

T evict(java.lang.String key)
Removes the Fragment stored under the argument key if one exists.

Parameters:
key - The key of a Fragment to evict.
Returns:
The Fragment if it was found, otherwise null.

evict

boolean evict(java.lang.String key,
              T expected)
Removes the Fragment stored under the argument key if one exists and it equals the Fragment referenced by the argument Fragment.

Parameters:
key - The key of a Fragment to evict.
expected - The Fragment expected to be removed.
Returns:
true if the argument key was mapped to the argument Fragment, otherwise false.

keyIterator

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> keyIterator()
Returns:
An Iterator for the keys in the cache.

put

T put(java.lang.String key,
      T fragment)
Associates the specified key to the specified Fragment in this cache. Neither the key nor the Fragment can be null. The Fragment can be retrieved by calling the get method with a key that is equal to the original key.

Parameters:
key - the key
fragment - the Fragment
Returns:
Previous Fragment of the specified key in this cache, or null if it did not have one.

putIfAbsent

T putIfAbsent(java.lang.String key,
              T fragment)
Associates the specified Fragment with the specified key if there is not one already. This is equivalent to 
      if (!cache.contains(key)) {
          cache.put(key, fragment);
      }
      return cache.get(key);
except that the action is performed atomically.

Parameters:
key - key with which the specified Fragment is to be associated
fragment - Fragment to be associated with the specified key
Returns:
Current Fragment associated with specified key. If the cache previously associated a Fragment with the specified key, the old Fragment is returned, otherwise the argument Fragment is returned.

replace

T replace(java.lang.String key,
          T expected,
          T replacement)
Replace Fragment for key only if currently mapped to some value. Acts as 
      if (cache.get(key).equals(expected)) {
          cache.put(key, replacement);
          return replacement;
      } else return cache.get(key);
except that the action is performed atomically.

Parameters:
key - key with which the specified Fragment is associated
expected -
replacement -
Returns:
Current Fragment associated with the specified key. If the previous Fragment equaled the expected, then the replacement Fragment is returned.

size

int size()
Returns:
The number of fragments currently in the cache.
